snippet: The auto insurer Progressive may have done everything wrong in a lawsuit that became a cause célèbre on social media this week, but there’s a lesson for us all in the details.
abstract: Ron Lieber Your Money column explores lawsuit in which the car insurance company Progressive sent a lawyer to help defend the driver of a car who had killed Katie Fisher, its policyholder, in an accident; notes public anger over incident quickly spread after the deceased's brother, Matt, posted about it on Tumblr; says incident is a good opportunity for consumers to review the terms of their own liability insurance.
lead_paragraph: The auto insurer Progressive may have done everything wrong in a lawsuit that became a cause célèbre on social media this week, but there’s a lesson for us all in the details.

headline.print_headline: An Insurance Case That Flooded the Net
headline.seo: Progressive’s Side of the Insurance Case That Blew Up on the Internet
headline.main: The Auto Insurance Case That Blew Up on the Internet
